author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
In early morn, the market fair,
FTSE 100 doth rise in air,
Associated British Foods, a hearty gainer,
Whilst Vodafone and Brands Imper'yal wane in favour.

Telecom Italia, a blow of fate,
As CDP doth its bid abate,
A missive sent from the state lender,
Heralds the fall of teleco's splendor.

Behold, a woe on China's shore,
Their youth in search of work and more,
Unemployment vast, now twenty score,
A stalling sign for dreams of yore.

feedItems.title: FTSE 100 Rises as ABF Gains; Imperial Brands, Vodafone Fall
feedItems.description: The FTSE 100 Index rose 0.3% in early trading, as gains for Associated British Foods offset losses for Vodafone and Imperial Brands.

feedItems.title: Telecom Italia Hit as CDP Reportedly Pulls Bid
feedItems.description: Telecom Italia shares fell after Bloomberg reported that Italian state lender CDP planned to pull out of the bidding process for the teleco’s fixed-network assets.

feedItems.title: China's Youth Unemployment Tops 20% Amid Signs of Stalling Recovery
feedItems.description: China’s youth unemployment rate rose above 20% for the first time since Beijing began tracking the data five years ago.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
Upon the waves of silver's course,
Did fall the Sterling's mighty force;
Unforeseen the jobless tide,
The rate of June, a chance denied.

From East the Crude, of oil did trace,
Its falter 'gainst a dire embrace;
In China's realm, the fire burned weak,
Where blackened gold sought strength to eke.

The Metal kin, in wonder wrought,
By China's strife, a somber thought;
The plague still lingers on their breath,
Whilst gold and base face trails of death.

feedItems.title: Sterling Falls as Weaker Labor Data Could Dent Chances of June Rate Rise
feedItems.description: Sterling fell after data showed the U.K. jobless rate unexpectedly edged up in the first quarter, while wage growth was slightly below forecasts, with the figures increasing the possibility the BOE could pause raising rates, ING said.

feedItems.title: Crude Oil Inches Lower Amid Demand Worries
feedItems.description: Crude prices edged lower after Chinese industrial output data disappointed, although April’s refining numbers pointed to more positive signs of demand, ING said.

feedItems.title: Metals Slip Amid China Economy Weakness
feedItems.description: Base metals and gold were moving lower as worries over demand lingered, with data showing China’s economy was struggling to recover from the effects of Covid-19.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
In market's grasp, ye bond yields ease,
Their sights held fast on data's keys.
On macro's pulse, the eyes now gaze,
Uncertainty, amidst the ways.

Bouygues doth proclaim a goal,
Loss in quarters takes its toll.
Yet profits rise, ambitions swell,
Through troubled times, their fortunes quell.

Imperial Brands, their torch holds still,
In year's embrace, their coffers will.
We mark their progress, steadfast rise,
A steady hand, amid the skies.

feedItems.title: Eurozone Bond Yields Ease as Market Focus Is on Economic Data
feedItems.description: Eurozone 10-year bond yields were trading lower at the open, with macroeconomic indicators likely an increasing market factor in coming days and weeks, with views about a looming U.S. recession varying widely, Commerzbank said.

feedItems.title: Bouygues Confirms Outlook After First-Quarter Loss
feedItems.description: Bouygues confirmed it was targeting sales this year close to the level of 2022 and an increase in operating profit, after it reported an operating loss of €14 million in the first quarter

feedItems.title: Imperial Brands Sticks to Guidance After Solid First Half
feedItems.description: Imperial Brands said it was on track to meet its full-year guidance as it posted a 28% rise in operating profit and stable revenue for the first half of fiscal 2023.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
Of Vodafone's profits, flat they say,
Eleven thousand jobs, they sadly slay,
A mead of bitter taste, unsway'd,
Their performance not good enough display'd.

In realm of Britain, works do few'r find,
Unemployment higher, wages unbind,
Employers raise pay, pressures uncoil,
God grant them reprieve from labor's toil.

And, lo, the tale of Michael Vale, 3M's chief,
In misconduct's bonds, he finds grief,
Dismiss'd with shame, they do declare,
In Holy path, may he righteously repair.

feedItems.title: Vodafone Forecasts Flat Profits; to Cut Jobs
feedItems.description: Vodafone said it expected adjusted Ebitda to be flat at around €13.3 billion this year, as it announced plans to cut 11,000 jobs over three years, admitting that its performance had not been good enough.

feedItems.title: UK Unemployment Rate, Pay Growth Tick Up
feedItems.description: The U.K. unemployment rate stood at 3.9% in the first quarter of 2023, slightly higher than expectations, while pay growth continued to rise, reflecting a little slacking in the labor market and continuing pressures on employers to raise wages.

feedItems.title: 3M said it fired company president Michael Vale, citing inappropriate personal conduct and violation of company policy by the longtime executive.
feedItems.description: 3M said it fired company president Michael Vale, citing inappropriate personal conduct and violation of company policy by the longtime executive.
